node.title: 'A delightful little girl': WA Premier Mark McGowan meets Cleo Smith and her family after dramatic rescue
node.alt: Three men walk across the tarmac of an airstrip
node.description: The WA Premier says four-year-old Cleo Smith is a "delightful little girl" and very "well adjusted" considering her ordeal, as he meets the four-year-old and her family in Carnarvon.
node.content: ["WA Premier Mark McGowan has described Cleo Smith as a \"delightful little girl\" after he met the four-year-old and her family in Carnarvon following the little girl's dramatic rescue on Tuesday.", "\"It was a lovely experience to meet her,\" he said.", "\"She was, I felt very well-adjusted .. and the family were very appreciative of everything that had been done for them.", "\"[They are]\u00a0fundamentally decent, honest human beings, they were lovely people and it was great to meet them and acknowledge what they have been through.\"", "Mr McGowan, who arrived in the coastal town bearing two teddy bears, one for Cleo and the other for her baby sister Isla, spent some time with the family at their home.", "He said the family was\u00a0doing well.", "\"We have a way to go from here, but they are on\u00a0the right pathway,\" Mr McGowan said.", "\"[They are]\u00a0very grateful for everything that the police have done\u00a0... normal people\u00a0that had no complaints, they had no demands.", "\"I said to them, there are so many resources here to help you,\u00a0whatever they need, they knew that.", "\"They were nice people. They weren't difficult at all.\"", "\"[Cleo] has done a bit of sleeping and a lot of eating, a lot of lying around and cuddling, just connecting [as]\u00a0 parents with their little daughters.\""]
